feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: FUE Consumption Monitoring
entry.content:
Hi All,
 
One of our customers is requesting us to monitor their FUE consumption. We are not able to see this data in the SAP4Me portal for this particular customer. We have implemented Note 3333812. Even then, the FUE consumption details were not showing up in SAP4Me, for which they have mentioned that the metering results are available in SAP for me only if the systems are hosted by SAP. Since the systems of our customers are hosted by a Premium supplier, this metering data is not available with SAP, and we will have to reach out to your Premium supplier.
 
What is the best way to propose a solution to our customer here? Do the premium suppliers provide an option to allow the consumption monitoring? Any suggestions are welcome on this topic.
 
Regards
Lakshmi

entry.title: Unclassified User Type
entry.content:
Hi All

Please find that when we run the program "SLIM%DEV%CLF%HELP" report to check the User classifications, the report output shows "Not Classified" category of User types, along with the core, advanced and self-service types. How can we measure the FUE for the "Not classified" category?

Any suggestions on the same are welcome!

Regards

Lakshmi

entry.title: EWM-TM Integration: Clean Core alternative to unreleased BAdI in S/4HANA PCE
entry.content:
Hey community,

I'm implementing EWM with TM in S/4HANA Private Cloud Edition and hitting a Clean Core compliance issue.

Scenario: When TM is active in the system and I try to process goods issue in EWM (transaction /SCWM/PRDO), I get this error:

/SCWM/LK202 – TU for delivery assignment &1 / &2 not found

This happens because when TM is configured, the system automatically sets TRANSPL_TYPE = 'C' (when TMS_PLAN_IND = 'X'), which means EWM expects a Transportation Unit before allowing the goods issue. This blocks the entire outbound process.

Standard solution (blocked in PCE)
Note 3084918 addresses this - implement BAdI /SCWM/EX_ERP_MAPIN_OD_SAVEREPL and in method MAPIN, clear the field TRANSPL_TYPE in structure MT_DLV_REQUEST-s_head-t_transport.

The logic is simple and it works perfectly in on-premise systems. But here's the problem: in S/4HANA PCE with ABAP Cloud, the ATC check fails:

Error: Usage of not released application API: /SCWM/IF_EX_MAPIN_OD_SAVEREPL
Code: CHKC_IFACE_NOT_RELEASED

Can't transport this to production as it violates Clean Core principles.

What I've Tried
Looked for alternative BAdIs that might have access to TRANSPL_TYPE - no luck
Checked if there's any customizing to prevent the default 'C' value - nothing found
Searched for released APIs in the same process - all the relevant ones are unreleased
Tried to find workarounds in /SCWM/TU (called internally by /SCWM/PRDO) - same restrictions

Questions for the Community
Is there a released BAdI or API that allows modifying TRANSPL_TYPE in this EWM-TM scenario?
Any configuration trick to prevent the system from defaulting to transport type 'C' when TM is active?
Has anyone solved this in a Clean Core compliant way? Maybe a different approach I'm not seeing?
Does SAP have plans to release this BAdI for cloud environments? It seems like a standard requirement for EWM-TM integration.
This is becoming a blocker for the go-live. The functionality works great with the BAdI, but I need a solution that passes ATC checks.

Will definitely post the solution here once I find it. Thanks in advance!

Technical Details:

S/4HANA PCE 2023
Transaction: /SCWM/PRDO (Outbound Delivery Order)
Error occurs during goods issue processing
ABAP Cloud with strict ATC enforcement

entry.title: Tracking and Managing Reusable Packaging Materials in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
entry.content:
We are a polyurethane chemical manufacturing business with manufacturing and distribution entities.
Our finished goods and raw materials are packed in either drums or IBCs, or within more than 10 types of packages, which can be new, reused, or renewed.

We need to track package materials inventory, both empty and filled, and capture packaging costs accurately.
We also need detailed inventory visibility for empty packages that are possible to be used.

We are discovering the Handling Unit module but it seems to have many manual steps and difficult to implement.

Has anyone with similar operations solved this in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, and how did you approach it?

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

entry.title: Manage Workflow for Supplier Invoice – Authorization & Decision Options Issue
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I am using SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023. While configuring Manage Workflow for Supplier Invoice, we created simple rules and it worked fine. We did SPRO configuration  activated flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices (please refer to the attached screenshots for reference).

We noticed the following behavior:

  • If I check the Authorization option, the workflow does not trigger.

  • If I uncheck the Authorization option, the workflow triggers but in release/approve option not avail.

In the authorizer’s decision-making screen, the user is unable to see the expected Release/Approve or Reject options.
Instead, it shows Open Task, and under that, only Post or Delete actions are available (screenshot attached).

is this the standard behavior in S4 private cloud for supplier invoice workflow.

please guide me if any configuration changes are needed to get the proper.

 

 

thanks & regards,

silambarasan R

entry.title: Failed to create a source system based on SAP S/4HANA 2023 in SAP BW 7.5 SPS15
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I encountered an issue when trying to create a source system based on SAP S/4HANA 2023 in SAP BW 7.5 SPS15.

It appears to be a connection configuration problem.
The background user password for the RFC Destination (DEVCLNT110 for SAP S/4HANA 2023 Private Cloud Edition) in BW becomes invalid after configuration.

BW System message in RFC Destination for S/4HANA:

User password invalid for identifier /RFC/DEVCLNT110 (see long text)


Diagnosis:
Changes to the global key or system data have invalidated the passwords in secure storage.

 

ABAP Short Dump in ST22:

Category: External Error

Runtime Errors: CALL_FUNCTION_REMOTE_ERROR

Short Text: "Name or password is incorrect (repeat logon)"

Has anyone encountered a similar problem?
Any guidance or solutions would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

Regards,

entry.title: Manage Purchase Order App – Header Level Condition Type Not Available for Landed Cost Elements
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are working on SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023 and using the Fiori native app “Manage Purchase Orders”.

Issue observed:

  • In the app, we are not able to see or select header-level condition types.
  • Specifically, we require these condition types to capture landed cost elements (e.g., freight, insurance, customs duties).
  • In the classic GUI transactions (ME21N/ME22N), header conditions are available. However, in the Fiori app they do not appear.

Questions:

  1. Is this functionality supported in the Manage Purchase Orders app?
  2. If not available, is there any roadmap item or SAP Note that enables header-level conditions in this Fiori app?
  3. What is the recommended best practice for handling landed cost conditions if we want to work fully in Fiori without reverting to “Advanced” (GUI-based) apps?

Any guidance or references would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,
Jeeva

entry.title: Hello SAP Community,We recently completed an upgrade from SAP S/4HANA 2021 to SAP S/4HANA 2023
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

We recently completed an upgrade from SAP S/4HANA 2021 to SAP S/4HANA 2023 (Private Cloud Edition). After raising a service request regarding post-upgrade checks, SAP responded by referring us to SAP Note 2907976 – Silent Data Migration (SDMI).

I would like to understand:

  • What exactly does this note cover?
  • Is it mandatory to take any action based on this note after the upgrade?
  • How critical is SDMI in the context of system stability or data consistency?
  • Are there any recommended steps or best practices to follow related to SDMI after an upgrade?

Any insights or experiences from others who have gone through a similar upgrade would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Project Systems error on 'Aggregation Levels invalid'
entry.content:
Hi there,

I have an issue while posting from legacy system to S4 Hana (Private Cloud), where I am testing the functionality of below APIs:

  1. API_API_FINPLANNINGDATA_SRV/PlanData 
    Using limited fields (in payload) or complete set of fields (payload) results in this error: 
    'Resource not found for the segment 'PlanData'." Refers to SAP Note: 1797736 
     
  2. API_API_FINPLANNINGDATA_SRV/FinancialPlanData
    Same as above, but throws additional errors as system gets into additional validation for those fields that we don't input any values, and  we leave it with basic 'string' only.
     
  3. I realize we need to use the full payload, with a view to accommodate more fields in future.
  4. Question is: is it safe to use partial 'values based' fields only as in (1) above? 
  5. In any case, I get into 'Aggregation levels invalid' error. Not sure what I am missing? Can someone guide me, please? 

Any clue shall be helpful. 

Regards Siva

entry.title: SAP Joule Introduction and its applications in SAP FICO
entry.content:
What Is SAP Joule?

SAP Joule is SAP’s AI copilot embedded across its cloud applications. It offers four interaction types—Transactional, Navigational, Informational, and Analytical—that let users perform business tasks via natural language within SAP environments. It understands user context, roles, permissions, and remains secure by design. It can also ground responses in your own business documents.

 How SAP Joule works in Public vs. Private Cloud is one of the most important considerations for finance teams (especially in FICO) deciding on adoption.

Here’s a structured view:

🔹 SAP Joule in Public vs. Private Cloud

  1. Deployment & Integration
  • Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
    • Joule is natively embedded and updated by SAP automatically.
    • Integration with SAP FICO apps (GL, AP, AR, Asset Accounting, Controlling) is out of the box.
    • No additional installation required - users just activate and configure.
  • Private Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition)
    • Joule can be enabled, but may require additional setup and integration.
    • Some Joule features might lag behind public cloud, because public gets innovations first.
    • Still integrates with FICO, but might require extra configuration & tenant connections to SAP BTP.
  1. Feature Availability
  • Public Cloud
    • Joule supports all 4 interaction types (Transactional, Navigational, Informational, Analytical) directly in Fiori apps.
    • Example in FICO: “Post vendor invoice” → transaction executes directly.
    • Faster delivery of Joule Agents and Joule Studio.
  • Private Cloud
    • Informational & Analytical features available early (queries, reports, insights).
    • Transactional flows may require enablement through custom skills/agents.
    • Joule Studio can still be connected via SAP BTP, but adoption speed depends on customer’s upgrade cycle.
  1. Customization & Extensibility
  • Public Cloud
    • Limited custom coding—extensions must go through SAP BTP side-by-side development.
    • Joule skills/agents are mostly standardized.
    • Great if you want speed & standardization.
  • Private Cloud
    • More flexibility: you can create custom FICO processes, reports, and Joule agents.
    • Easier to integrate with on-prem or legacy systems.
    • Suited for companies with complex finance processes.
  1. Data Security & Residency
  • Public Cloud
    • Data is hosted on SAP-managed hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, GCP, SAP DCs).
    • Joule queries financial data via secure APIs; customers rely on SAP’s compliance.
  • Private Cloud
    • You control hosting, location, and more of the security stack.
    • Some finance-heavy industries (banking, defense, public sector) may prefer this for regulatory reasons.
  1. Upgrade & Innovation
  • Public Cloud
    • Quarterly upgrades → Joule features arrive first and fastest.
    • Example: New Joule Agents for FICO tasks (like dispute resolution) appear immediately.
  • Private Cloud
    • Annual upgrades (with optional Feature Packs).
    • Joule features arrive later—innovation follows public cloud by a few cycles.

📊 Comparison Table

Aspect

Public Cloud

Private Cloud

Availability

Native, out-of-the-box

Needs setup, later adoption

Updates

Quarterly, fastest innovations

Annual/controlled upgrades

Customization

Limited, BTP-based

Flexible, deep customizations

Security

SAP-managed hyperscalers

Customer-controlled

FICO Use Cases

Immediate transactional & analytical support

Strong for complex, regulated finance scenarios

Joule Studio

Fully available

Available via BTP, more flexible

✅ Which is Better for FICO?

  • Public Cloud → Best if you want rapid innovation, standard finance processes, faster AI adoption.
  • Private Cloud → Best if you need deep customization, strict compliance, hybrid IT integration.

 SAP Joule version requirements for S/4HANA Cloud editions (Public and Private):

  1. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Joule arrived as part of the Public Cloud starting around Q3 2024, and is embedded in all releases thereafter, including 2408 (August 2024) and onward.
  • While Joule is built into these releases, you still need proper entitlement and authorization to use it; this may require activation via your SAP admin or account executive.
  • There are setup guides available detailing how to activate Joule once entitlement is granted.

In Summary:

If your system is on Public Cloud release 2408 (Aug 2024) or later, Joule is already supported—assuming you've got the right access and permissions.

  1. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • Joule is available in the Private Cloud as well, but requires setup and configuration. It's not automatically active—you must enable it via SAP BTP and Joule Studio.
  • Technical prerequisites include ensuring the UI5 version in your system meets or exceeds the minimum required for Joule integration. The specific UI5 version will depend on your release; you can consult SAP documentation for exact details.

In Summary:

Private Cloud systems can support Joule—but you must set it up, ensure the UI5 stack is compatible, and configure the feature via BTP.

  1. SAP S/4HANA On-Premise (Classic)
  • Joule is not supported on on-premise S/4HANA. SAP has confirmed it's not on the current roadmap for classic on-premise systems.
  • There’s a planned strategy—possibly coming Q1 2025—to enable Joule via SAP Build Work Zone, BTP, and Joule Studio even for on-prem systems. But as of now, Joule remains unavailable on-prem and unsupported.

High-Level Overview

Edition

Supported from (release)

Requirements

Public Cloud

2408 (Aug 2024) onward

Needs entitlement/authorization & activation

Private Cloud

Post-2024 releases

Requires UI5 prerequisites + BTP/Joule Studio setup

On-Premise (classic)

Not supported (as of now)

No Joule availability; roadmap may include future BTP-based solution

Summary:

  • Public Cloud: Joule is supported starting with 2408 onward—activate it via entitlement.
  • Private Cloud: Joule is available but not automatic—requires UI compliance + setup via BTP.
  • On-Premise: Joule is not supported yet; no built-in version availability.

Here’s how SAP Joule, SAP’s generative AI assistant, can be applied specifically within the SAP FICO (Finance & Controlling) domain:

SAP Joule Application in FICO

  1. Transactional Interactions

Joule allows users to perform CRUD operations and manage financial documents via natural language—imagine asking:

  • “Post a vendor invoice of $5,000 to account X with due date Y.”
  • “Show me the status of PO invoice 10234.”
    While SAP hasn't yet released out-of-the-box FICO conversational flows, Joule’s transactional model supports this kind of interaction across cloud applications.
  1. Navigational Interactions

Instead of navigating through menus to reach Fiori apps like “Display GL Account Balances,” you could simply ask:

  • “Where can I review G/L balances?”
    Joule will direct you to the relevant screen.
  1. Informational Interactions

Straight answers instead of digging through help docs. You can ask:

  • “What’s the difference between cost center and profit center accounting?”
  • “Explain account determination for automatic postings.”
    Joule will deliver concise explanations, referencing SAP documentation or your own policy documents.
  1. Analytical Interactions

Joule bridges your natural-language queries to data analytics:

  • “Show me quarterly expense trends per cost center.”
  • “Which cost centers exceeded budget last quarter?”
    It returns charts, metrics, or dashboards—leveraging SAP Analytics Cloud integration.

Advanced: Joule Agents & Studio

Joule Agents

SAP has introduced AI agents—autonomous actors capable of executing complex, multi-step workflows across business functions. In FICO, custom agents could:

  • Automate dispute resolution: Collaborate across finance and service teams to validate discrepancies and propose corrections.
  • Cash collection workflows: Analyze overdue invoices, coordinate with collections, and initiate follow-ups.
    These agents are part of SAP’s cross-functional automation strategy.

Joule Studio (within SAP Build)

No-code/low-code tool to create custom skills or agents tailored for your FICO needs:

  • Build a skill to automatically generate internal financial reports, or trigger approval workflows.
  • Automate vendor reconciliation or recurring postings by designing tailored AI agents.
    These skills and agents integrate across SAP and non-SAP systems.

Summary Table

Joule Capability

FICO Use Case Example

Transactional

Post invoices, check payment status via natural language

Navigational

Ask “Where to view Cost Center Reports?”

Informational

Clarify financial terms or posting rules

Analytical

Generate trends and KPI charts using SAC

Agents & Studio

Automate dispute resolution, cash collection, approvals

Key Benefits in FICO

  • Boost Productivity: Save time by speaking instead of clicking through screens.
  • Reduce Errors: Leverage conversational clarity and auto-generated documents.
  • Improve Insights: Conduct data reviews and root cause analysis through simple dialogue.
  • Automate Complex Workflows: Agents handle multi-step tasks such as reconciliations or approvals automatically.

Real-World Usage Context -- Caveats

While SAP is rapidly developing Joule’s capabilities, many implementations remain in pilot or PoC stages. Users in forums report limited early usage, primarily for basic navigation or queries.

 

Here are concrete FICO scenarios where you could pilot SAP Joule and even extend it with Joule Agents / Studio:

🔹 Pilot Scenarios in SAP FICO

  1. Invoice & Payment Handling
  • Ask Joule:
    “Post an invoice for vendor ABC with $12,000 due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Action: Creates the posting, validates tax code, and confirms with you.
  • Extension with Agent: Automate follow-up—if payment not cleared by due date, Joule Agent triggers a reminder email or escalates.
  1. Month-End Close Assistant
  • Ask Joule:
    “What are the pending tasks for month-end close?”
  • Joule Action: Lists open items (accruals, GR/IR clearing, reconciliations).
  • Extension with Agent: Automate recurring accrual postings and send alerts to approvers who are late in providing confirmations.
  1. Financial Analysis & Insights
  • Ask Joule:
    “Show me expense trend per cost center for last 6 months.”
  • Joule Action: Returns a chart (via SAC integration).
  • Extension with Agent: Forecast next quarter’s expenses and flag cost centers that may exceed budgets.
  1. Audit & Compliance Checks
  • Ask Joule:
    “List journal entries above $50,000 in the last quarter without approvals.”
  • Joule Action: Generates a filtered list.
  • Extension with Agent: Create an automated internal audit agent that periodically checks for compliance exceptions and notifies controllers.
  1. Treasury & Cash Management
  • Ask Joule:
    “What is today’s cash position?”
  • Joule Action: Summarizes bank balances, incoming/outgoing payments.
  • Extension with Agent: Auto-generate a daily treasury dashboard at 9 AM and send to CFO.
  1. Dispute & Collections Management
  • Ask Joule:
    “Show me customers with invoices overdue > 60 days.”
  • Joule Action: Lists overdue accounts.
  • Extension with Agent: An AI agent sends personalized payment reminders and schedules calls with collections staff.
  1. Budget vs. Actual Control
  • Ask Joule:
    “Which cost centers exceeded budget last quarter?”
  • Joule Action: Shows variances with drill-down.
  • Extension with Agent: Automatically notify budget owners when variances exceed a threshold (say 10%).

🔹 How to Design in Joule Studio

In Joule Studio (within SAP Build) you can:

  1. Create a Skill → “Generate quarterly P&L by company code and send PDF to finance team.”
  2. Create an Agent → “Monitor overdue vendor payments and auto-initiate dunning.”
  3. Connect Non-SAP Apps → e.g., send approvals via MS Teams or Slack.

👉 This way, Joule moves from a copilot (answering queries) to a colleague (executing finance tasks for you).

 

Deep Dive on one of the real-world example: Vendor Invoice Posting with SAP Joule in Public vs Private Cloud.

🧾 Example: Vendor Invoice Posting with Joule

🔹 Scenario

A finance user wants to post a vendor invoice for Vendor 300012, amount $12,000, due in 30 days.

1️⃣ Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)

  • User says to Joule:
    👉 “Post a vendor invoice of $12,000 for Vendor 300012, due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Process:
    1. Understands the intent (“Create Vendor Invoice”).
    2. Pulls relevant master data (Vendor 300012 details, tax code, payment terms).
    3. Pre-fills the invoice screen in Fiori.
    4. User confirms → Invoice is posted.
  • Extras in Public Cloud:
    • Joule can immediately display the document number and due date schedule.
    • If connected to SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Joule can also show how this impacts cash outflow forecast.
    • Minimal setup → available out-of-the-box.

2️⃣ Private Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition)

  • User says to Joule:
    👉 “Post a vendor invoice of $12,000 for Vendor 300012, due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Process:
    1. Joule recognizes intent, but instead of direct posting, it may:
      • Provide navigation → “Open FB60 (Vendor Invoice Entry)” or “Fiori App: Create Supplier Invoice.”
      • Pre-fill metadata only if integrated with custom Joule Skill via Joule Studio.
    2. User manually confirms or adjusts in the classic posting screen (e.g., FB60 / MIRO).
    3. Invoice is posted.
  • Extras in Private Cloud:
    • You can customize Joule Agent (via Joule Studio + BTP) to enforce company-specific validations (e.g., block invoices >$10,000 without 2 approvals).
    • Joule can connect to legacy non-SAP apps (like OCR invoice scanners or in-house workflow systems).
    • Requires more setup & governance compared to Public Cloud.

📊 Side-by-Side Comparison

Step

Public Cloud

Private Cloud

Activation

Native, plug-and-play

Needs setup & integration

Invoice Posting

Joule executes directly in Fiori app

Joule suggests navigation, may require custom agent for automation

Data Validation

Standard rules auto-applied

Flexible, can embed custom compliance rules

User Effort

Minimal (voice/text → posted)

Moderate (confirmation in screen, extra steps if no custom agent)

Analytics

Immediate cash flow impact via SAC

Possible, but may need manual SAC integration

Customization

Limited (SAP-standard process)

Flexible (custom workflows, approvals, legacy integration)

✅ Takeaway:

  • In Public Cloud, Joule = speed + simplicity → perfect for companies with standard finance processes.
  • In Private Cloud, Joule = control + flexibility → better if you need extra compliance steps, custom posting logic, or hybrid integration.

Joule SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics SAP S/4HANA Finance SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Service SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Sales

entry.title: Auto SES for Multiple PO Line items
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Could someone help if there is any customization we can do in SAP S/4 Private cloud to enable or Automate Service Entry Sheet for multiple PO line items? Has anyone ever done this? I am aware there are multiple threads in this forum explaining about having one PO line and maintaining different service lines, but our business requirement is to have multiple PO line items, and each line item may have one or more services lines.

Any guidance on the program level changes if anyone has ever done would be very much appreciated. We are looking a way to automate the SES, may be a custom program by providing the Service PO number and the program can generate service entry sheets automatically based on the PO line items and the respective services lines in it.

Thanks,

Velu

SAP S/4HANA

entry.title: Error fetching OData V4 services in VSCode
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to publish an annotation driven Fiori application written in OData V4 through VSCode on a private cloud system. I published the service through /IWFND/V4_ADMIN and can see in ADT that the service binding is active and the preview is working.

I have added my system. When I test the connection I get the following messages in the console:

[info] This SAP System <XXX> returned 423 V2 and 0 V4 services.
[error] The V4 request failed with error: Request failed with status code 404.
 
I assume in this context that 404 stands for "not found". Does anyone have any idea where can I enable it?
 
All the best,
Ben

entry.title: Commerce Automation - MIRO Invoice to SAP Business network
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

Could someone please confirm, in Ariba Commerce Automation, do we have a scenario where we will be able to send the MIRO Invoice to SAP Business Network?

Per our understanding of the Standard Commerce Automation scenarios. When we send a PO to SAP Business network from S/4HANA Private Cloud ERP or SAP ECC. Supplier can submit the invoice from Network and that will create the Invoice in S/4 Automatically, this is standard and working perfectly fine for us. In this case, if the supplier submits a Paper invoice to AP team, can they create invoice through MIRO T.Code in SAP and send the invoice to SAP business network? Can some please confirm if this channel is available by standard?

The other channel for sending invoice from SAP to SAP Business network what we have seen is through the ERS (Evaluated Receipt Settlement), by this channel, once the PO is created with the ERS flag at the line-item level, the invoice will be generated in SAP through the MRRL T.Code and these invoices will have the ERS output type which will then be sent to Network. So our question is, to send invoices from SAP to SAP Business network, is this the only channel, can we not send the invoices from SAP to Business Network via the MIRO at all? 

Thanks,
Velu

#SAPS/4HANA

entry.title: How to fetch Profit Segment in FB60 Invoice posting in S4 Private Cloud
entry.content:
Hi there, 

I am in S4 Hana Private Cloud FPS 2023 Release 02 (Oct 2024). 

I need to post thru API JournalEntryCreateRequestConfirmation_In

I am able to post a simple Journal entry, without profit segment. If my expense line is hitting P&L account, I have Product and Profit Center, with which I need to derive Profit Segment for various COPA characteristics. How can I ensure I am passing all relevant fields within the API so the Profit Segment is deriving properly. 

When I pass the API thru Postman test for instance, I am succeeding to push the API, still, I am NOT seeing the document posted already. It takes a while to dig deep based on each type of error and trouble-shoot them one by one. 

I checked in other forums, I get different feedback that I am not clear, to determine what I am indeed missing. 

Can someone suggest appropriate steps in sequence, please? That would be helpful. 

Regards Siva

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA does not support automatic split purchase order by WBS code / storage location
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We are currently working with SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023  in a company that operates under a centralized purchasing model.

In SAP Business One, when creating a Purchase Order, if the items belong to different warehouses, the system automatically splits the PO into multiple purchase orders (one per warehouse). This is very useful for companies with centralized procurement but distributed warehouses/divisions, as it simplifies receiving and accounting at the warehouse level.

In SAP S/4HANA, I have observed that this functionality is not available by default. Instead, the system allows one PO to contain items for multiple plants/warehouses, and the logistics are handled separately.

👉 My questions are:

  1. Is there a standard option/configuration in S/4HANA to achieve automatic PO split by warehouse/plant (similar to SAP Business One)?

  2. If not standard, what is the recommended best practice for centralized purchasing with bulk discounts and later distribution to different warehouses/divisions?

  3. Is the solution to use Stock Transport Orders (STO) or Central Procurement Hub after creating one bulk PO at the head office?

  4. Has anyone implemented a custom BAdI enhancement (e.g., ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST) to mimic this B1 functionality in S/4HANA?

This is a critical requirement for us since our business negotiates bulk discounts with suppliers and then distributes materials to multiple warehouses.

Any guidance, best practices, or experience sharing will be highly appreciated.

Thanks & Regards,

silambarasan RS
